headline: Spicy Coconut and Lime Grilled Shrimp
description: This easy coconut lime shrimp recipe with a touch of spice from jalapeño peppers is a perfect appetizer for summer cookouts.
name: Spicy Coconut and Lime Grilled Shrimp
recipeIngredient: 1 pound uncooked medium shrimp, peeled and deveined
bamboo skewers, soaked in water for 30 minutes

recipeInstructions.text: Combine jalapeños, lime zest, lime juice, and garlic in a blender. Add cilantro, coconut, oil, and soy sauce; blend until smooth.
Place shrimp in a large glass or ceramic bowl. Pour in marinade and toss to evenly coat. Cover with plastic wrap and marinate in the refrigerator for at least 2 hours.
Preheat an outdoor grill for medium-high heat and lightly oil the grate.
Remove shrimp from marinade and gently shake off excess. Discard remaining marinade.
Thread shrimp onto skewers, piercing each shrimp near the head and tail.
Place skewers onto the preheated grill; cook until nicely browned on all sides and the meat is opaque, 2 to 3 minutes per side.

review.reviewBody: Let me tell you... I never, I mean NEVER ever want to eat any other kind of shrimp other than these again! OMG! They are utterly delicious! I did change it slightly... I was having a party consisting of 50+ people coming so I had to up the quantities. Upon reading other reviews, I made the following changes... I used 6 pounds of shrimp, 9 jalapenos, 5 large lime (just the juice, I guess in my rush, I didn't remember to zest them), 7 heaping tablespoons minced garlic, 2 cups fresh cilantro, 2 cups sweetened shredded coconut, 1 cup oil & 1 cup soy sauce. I also added one can of coconut milk to the mix. Zipped everything through my food processor and marinated the shrimp for 3-4 hours. My marinade was not thick but it was chunky and when I skewered them, I made sure I didn't shake anything off of them, so what stuck to the shrimp stayed on the shrimp. Hubby grilled them up and these were cleared out in no time at all! Even my husbands family who usually doesn't comment on the food was asking what was in them! That tells me something... Yum! I can't wait to eat these again!

We all loved this recipe. I didn’t add the garlic. I left the jalapeño in bigger chunks & grilled them. I served it with Caribbean rice & a salad. Made a dipping sauce with coconut milk yogurt, lime juice & zest, shredded coconut & cilantro.
This was delicious, I made it exactly as written. Next time I would use more lime juice. I like my lime to really come through stronger. It was excellent, simple and I will be making this again.
I served this with a cilantro, jalapeño and mango slaw. Everyone loved it!

Does every recipe on this site use garlic? You will not miss the garlic, trust me it is like adding salt, and you won't notice it is gone! I used 1 jalapeno, and I did not blend it either. Marinated for one hour and grilled, turned out great!
Didn't change a thing but next time I will use lg or ex lg shrimp. They fit better on the skewers and don't cook as fast as the medium shrimp did. If you use medium shrimp, buy 1 1/2 lbs.

Really, really loved this and since I'm working on losing weight it was a great choice. We used low-sodium soy sauce and unsweetened coconut which was a great option for texture without the syrupy taste I'm used to with most coconut shrimp recipes. I love spicy stuff, and could barely taste the jalapenos, so next time we'll at least double if not quadruple the peppers. We served it with coconut rice and black beans and it couldn't have been better.
After marinating, I tossed the shrimp to coat them with additional shredded coconut. I also added pineapple, papaya and mango cubes to skewers.

item.name: Spicy Coconut and Lime Grilled Shrimp
